definition: to practice/to train/to drill/to perfect (one's skill)/exercise/(literary) white silk/to boil and scour raw silk
root/stem/origin/source/this/the current/original/inherent/originally/classifier for books, periodicals, files etc

sentences.english: You must hand in your exercise-books after school.
sentences.chinese: 放学后你们必须把练习本交上来。

sentences.english: Her exercise-book is stained with ink marks.
sentences.chinese: 她的练习本上沾了墨迹。

sentences.english: Exchange your exercise books with your neighbor and correct each other's mistakes.
sentences.chinese: 把你的练习本和同桌交换，互相纠错。

sentences.english: Boys and girls, hand in your exercise books after class.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们，下课后把练习本交上来。

sentences.english: Here are your exercise books. Please give them out.
sentences.chinese: 这是你们的练习本，请发下去。

sentences.english: Please collect all the exercise books after class.
sentences.chinese: 请下课后把所有的练习本收上来。

sentences.english: There are many students' exercise books here.
sentences.chinese: 这儿有许多学生的练习本。

sentences.english: She jotted down a few notes, but later mistranscribed them into an exercise book.
sentences.chinese: 她草草做了些笔记，但后来错误的誊写在练习本上了。

sentences.english: Here are your exercise books. Please hand them out.
Write that in your exercise-books, please.
sentences.chinese: 请把那写在你们的练习本上。

sentences.english: I need it for pressing my exercise book.
sentences.chinese: 我拿它来把我的练习本压压平。

sentences.english: An Ming forgave her brother for tearing off a page from her exercise book.
sentences.chinese: 安明的弟弟从她练习本上撕了一页，她原谅了他。

sentences.english: Please hand in your exercise books.

definition: squared paper/graph paper/grid paper (manuscript paper with squares for Chinese characters)
book/notebook/Japanese-style self-published comic (esp. an erotic one), aka "dōjinshi"/CL:本[ben3]/edition
exercise book for practicing Chinese character handwriting (each page being a grid of blank cells divided into quadrants, like the character 田)
fine paper made from bamboo, used for calligraphy, painting etc/also written 毛邊|毛边[mao2 bian1]
